thread.title: NetworkingPhoenix.com to hold mass networking event
thread.title_full: NetworkingPhoenix.com to hold mass networking event

author: Ted Vollmuth, Phoenix Small Business Marketing Examiner
title: NetworkingPhoenix.com to hold mass networking event
text:
Signature Event for NetworkingPhoenix,com bing images 
She has become almost legend in the Valley of the Sun for her ability to bring business professionals together for networking that works. Gelie Akhenblit, founder and driving force behind NetworkingPhoenix.com holds massive networking events several times a year. Her next one is scheduled for Thursday August 20th from 6 to 9 p.m. at Chaparral Suites at 5001 Scottsdale Road in Scottsdale. 
The company’s events routinely draw over 1,500 people who exchange names, business cards and business gems. Often these encounters turn into not only prospects but also new business for many of the attendees. 
Akhenblit has some suggestions for how to make the most of the FREE event for those who are thinking about attending. She urges first consider an exhibitor’s table to make a major impression on future clients. She says these tables guarantee consistent non-stop traffic all night. There’s a pricing guide on the website. 
There is also a free networking seminar right before the event gets started. Get useful tips on how to network at the main event, how to seek out people you should meet and much, much more. Also, Akhenblit urges people to volunteer for a shift at registration. Being a greeter she notes, is a great way to meet other volunteers and attendees. 
Now that you’ve decided to attend this signature event what’s next? Respond to get your name on the list. Think about becoming a VIP Passport member which offers expedited check-in, access to the Passport Lounge and one free drink ticket. You can try Passport for 30 days for only $10.00. 
Sponsors for this event are Powerteam International, Scottsdale.com and Phoenix Public Relations and Marketing.
